dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Okay, later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Murphy talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schwartz comes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any news?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I was never so tired in my  life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Where? Harrison Street Station? All  right, connect me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Schwartz calling... Out with Hartman's  deputies. I'm in a drugstore. You  can't call me back because I'm going  right on with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up -- puts his feet on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right, now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm feelin' fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Mollie, you never looked better  in your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning from phone) Yeah, hold the line. Hey, this looks  good. An old lady just called the  detective bureau and claims Williams  is hiding in her cellar. Well - we've  looked every other place. Want to go  out on it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, nuts with chasing around any  more. I spent a dollar-forty on taxis  already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say we don't go out any more. Let  Earl Williams come to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fine bunch of reporters. Biggest  story in two years and they're too  lazy to go after it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's easy for you to talk. You're  retired. We're still working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. (into phone) Forget it. (he hangs up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter with you boys?  Afraid it might rain? If you want to  go, I'll cover this end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, Hildy, if I know you, you sound  pretty anxious to get rid of us. Are  you trying to scoop us or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something smells around here. If you  ask me Mollie gave her the story on  how Williams got that gun. (turning on Mollie) Did you smuggle that gun into  Williams, Mollie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't do nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crossing to Mollie) Come clean, Mollie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilson, Endicott and Murphy follow McCue toward Hildy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better let us in on it, Mollie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, why don't you let her alone?  She's ill!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you two are pals now -- I think  you're right, Endicott. Mollie did  give her some kind of story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell you, it's a screwy set-up. We  better hold onto 'em both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this point Mrs. Baldwin appears in the doorway. Hildy  gasps and starts for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Baldwin is in a very righteous mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as she comes in to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you mother me! Playing cat-and- mouse with my poor boy! Keeping him  looked up -- making us miss two trains --  and supposed to be married tomorrow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother, I can explain everything.  I'll go with you in five minutes and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to go with me at all!  Just give me my son's money and you  can stay here forever as far as I'm  concerned. Stay with that murderer  you caught!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as they get this. Reactions as they glance at one another

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Which one of these men is it? They  all look like murderers to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where does she get that stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we tell her what she looks  like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute! What murderer did you  catch, Hildy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reporters are looking intently at Hildy and Mrs. Bald

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what she's talking about.  I never said any such thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm quoting my son, and he has never  lied to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reporters move toward Hildy and Mrs. Baldwin speaking simultaneously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew something stunk around here --  Who says she caught him --? What do  you mean she caught a murderer --?  etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperately) But I never said anything like that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you did!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She never told her that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I was trying to catch one. (to Mrs. Baldwin) You got it balled up, Mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: taking in Mollie, with Murphy coming into scene to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you know about it? How do  you know she didn't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs her cruelly by an arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Endicott comes into scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on to her, Jimmy -- she's in  with Hildy on this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hildy tense with anxiety, her eyes on Mollie, off. Murphy comes viciously into scene to her and jerks Hildy by an a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who you holding out on? Come clean,  or we'll make you wish you had --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the rest of the reporters surround Hildy menacingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hildy) Hildy, are you gonna cross us for  Walter Burns after the way you told  him off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give in, Hildy -- you can't get away  with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! You stool-pigeons! She don't  know where Williams is. I'm the one  that knows.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT OF REPORTERS
dialogues.text: as they turn on Mollie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start for Mollie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mollie begins backing slowly around the table, away from  them, toward the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go find out, you heels! You don't  think I'm gonna tell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: who has remained riveted at desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her alone! She's goofy!

dialogues.speaker: MOLLIE AND REPORTERS
dialogues.text: Hemmed in by the massed reporters, she makes a sudden lun for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out! Close that door! etc.,  etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They split, some of them heading her off at door, others  from opposite side of table, so that she runs back betwee window and table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't gettin' out o' here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you hidin' him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't gonna squeal! I ain't goin'  to!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaning across table) Come on, you! Before we slap you  down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want us to call the cops and  have them give you the boots?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he, before we beat it out  of you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (backing) Don't you come near me, you kidney  foot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy continues to advance on her. The reporters start f her from the other side. Mollie snatches up a chair and s it at the advancing circle of men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wild and blubbering) Let me alone or I'll knock your heads  off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put down that chair!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get around -- get on the side of  her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still backing) No, you don't! (a scream) Keep away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grab her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a last, wild look at her encircling foes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll never get it out of me! (hurls chair at them) I'll never tell! Never!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She makes a desperate leap for the open window and disapp out. Her scream of terror is heard as she drops. THEN RUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the reporters rush in and look out, an assortment of a and astonished exclamations rising from them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns away from the window and hides her face in her  hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take me out of here! Take me -- (a moan) Oh-h --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She collapses to a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning) Get the cops, somebody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning) Come on, fellas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start in a rush for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the reporters rush out, and Hildy crosses, dazed to th window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee! The poor kid... the poor kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reaching the window, she looks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The form of Mollie on the pavement below moves slightly i the moonlight, as guards rush into scene to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (of guards rushing in) Get a doctor! Take her to the  infirmary! She ain't killed -- she's  moving!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hildy turns, shaken, back into the room from the window a sees advancing to her across the room Walter Burns. Diamo Louie has entered with the Boss and stands leaning by the door. Mrs. Baldwin's face is still hidden by her hands. H starts for Burns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter! D-did you see -- (gesturing back to  window) -- that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (comes in to him) She jumped out of the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Where is he, I said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: looking up at them, off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't shut up! That girl killed  herself. Oh-h, you're doing something  wrong. What's in that desk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burns slams closed the desk and steps to Louie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louie, take this lady over to Polack  Mike's and lock her up. See that she  doesn't take to anyone on the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that -- what's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Louie comes in to Mrs. Baldwin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, Walter. You can't do  that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (extending his hand  as if to shake hands  with Mrs. Baldwin) My name is Louis Peluso.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unluckily for her she responds, only to find herself jerk to her feet and spun around so that one of Louie's arms i about her waist and the other hand over her mouth. Louie  starts her to door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell 'em it's a case of delirium  tremens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with them -- Hildy catching up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, let go of her, Louie. Listen,  Walter, this'll get me in a terrible  jam with my fiance and I don't stand  so well with him now. Don't worry,  Mother, this is only temporary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the door, Louie gets Mrs. Baldwin out and disappears w her. Hildy starts after them, when Burns' arm comes into  scene, catching her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you think you're going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go o' me! I've got to get Bruce  out of jail! Oh, Walter, why did you  have to do this to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scornfully) Get Bruce out of jail! How can you  worry about a man who's resting  comfortably in a quiet police station  while this is going on? Hildy, this  is war! You can't desert now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, get off that trapeze! (indicating desk, off) There's your story! Smear it all  over the front page -- Earl Williams  caught by the Morning Post! And take  all the credit -- I covered your  story for you and I got myself in a  fine mess doing it -- and now I'm  getting out! I know I told you that  twice before today -- but this time  I mean it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You drooling idiot! What do you mean,  you're getting out! There are three  hundred and sixty-five days in the  year one can get married -- but how  many times have you got a murderer  locked up in a desk? -- Once in a  lifetime! Hildy, you've got the whole  city by the seat of the pants!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) You know! You've got the brain of a  pancake! That wasn't just a story  you covered -- it was a revolution!  Hildy! This is the greatest yarn in  journalism since Livingstone  discovered Stanley for the New York  Herald! (quickly closes the  door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly bewildered) Wait a minute -- wasn't it Stanley  who discovered Livingstone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get technical at a time like  this! Do you realize what you've  done? You've taken a city that's  been graft-ridden for forty years  under the same old gang and with  this yarn you're kicking 'em out and  giving us a chance to have the same  kind of government that New York's  having under La Guardia! We'll make  such monkeys out of these ward-heelers  next Tuesday that nobody'll vote for  them -- not even their wives!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the fire upon her) I'd like to think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, think it then, because it's  true! We'll crucify that mob. We're  going to keep Williams under cover  till morning so the Post can break  the story exclusive. Then we'll let  the Governor in on the capture --  share the glory with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) I get it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've kicked over the whole City  Hall like an apple-cart. You've got  the Mayor and Hartman backed against  a wall. You've put one administration  out and another in. This isn't a  newspaper story -- it's a career!  And you stand there belly-aching  about whether you catch an eight  o'clock train or a nine o'clock train!  Still a doll-faced mugg! That's all  you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me get at that typewriter and  I'll show you how a doll-faced mugg  can write!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attagirl! Why, they'll be naming  streets after you -- Hildy Johnson  Street! There'll be statues of you  in the parks, Hildy. The radio'll be  after you -- the movies! (slapping his fist  against his open  palm) By tomorrow morning I'll betcha  there's a Hildy Johnson cigar! I can  see the billboards now. Light up  with Hildy Johnson!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa -- wait a minute. We can't leave  Williams here. One of the other  fellows'll --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to take him over to my  private office. (turning) Where's our phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That one -- how you gonna take him?  They'll see him.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT AT TABLE
dialogues.text: as Burns gets phone and jiggles the hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if he's inside the desk. We'll  carry the desk over. (into phone) Give me Duffy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't take that desk out. It's  crawling with cops outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll lower it out of the window  with pulleys. Quit stallin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Hildy seems abstracted:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hildy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coming to) Huh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the lead out of your typewriter  and start pounding out a load, will  you? Snap into it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much do you want on it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the words you've got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning) Where's some paper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goes out of scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello...! Hello!

dialogues.speaker: SHOT AT DESK
dialogues.text: As Hildy comes in, going to desk, she turns to call back:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I call the Mayor a bird of prey --  or is that libelous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call him a love-child, if you want  to. (into phone) Duffy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having opened the drawers of Bensinger's desk, she is tos play manuscripts, syringes, patent medicines and old sock into the air, in a frantic search for paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling to Burns) How about the time he had his house  painted by the Fire Department?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give him the works. (into phone) Hello, Duffy, get set! We've got the  biggest story in the world. Earl  Williams caught by the Morning Post --  exclusive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hildy has unearthed a package of Bensinger's private  stationary. She rises with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hildy) Fine! (into phone) Now, listen, Duffy -- I want you to  tear out the whole front page...  That's what I said -- the whole front  page! Never mind the European war!  We've got something a whole lot bigger  than that. Hildy Johnson's writing  the lead and I'll phone it over to  you as soon as she's finished. (he starts to hang  up, then thinks of  something else) Oh, Duffy! Get hold of Butch O'Connor  and tell him I want him to come up  here with half a dozen other wrestlers --  right away! Tell him we'll run his  picture on the sport page for two  weeks straight. What? I've got a  desk I want moved. Never mind what  desk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the taxi darts through traffic, narrowly avoiding cars trucks, etc., it comes almost head-on to an oncoming car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louie, worried, ducks unconsciously. Mrs. Baldwin faints  across his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The taxi swerves just in time to duck the oncoming car. A it starts forward again a truck comes toward the cab, hea on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diamond Louie pushes Mrs. Baldwin into an upright positio takes a look through the windshield, sees the truck and g a big "takem" and faints across Mrs. Baldwin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck and taxicab crash and the screen blacks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at typewriter, smoke rising from her cigarette. As the CA ANGLE WIDENS we see a fairly disheveled Hildy typing away furiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into phone) "The Blackest cesspool in American  city life!" Hold on Duffy, I'll see  if she's got any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burns comes into the scene, tears a page out of Hildy's  typewriter. She inserts another one without noticing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burns goes back to the phone as Hildy continues to type  furiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Duffy -- Duffy! (clicking the phone  furiously) Operator! Operator! Get me Duffy  back. Somebody cut us off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Bruce Baldwin enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hildy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the devil do you want? Listen,  Bruce, you can't come in here now!  We're busy! (suddenly, into phone) Where you been, Duffy? Stick around!  What? What Chinese earthquake? The  deuce with it... what's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: typing away madly. Bruce comes into the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hildy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up, very  casually) Hello, Bruce...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She resumes her typing, then suddenly realizes the situat and jumps up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE!! How'd you get out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the hands-off attitude) Not through any help of yours, Hildy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce, I know, but I was in the  biggest jam --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hildy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Hildy turns toward his voice, Burns, still with the ph in his hand, keeps talking to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Pete's sake, Hildy, they're  waiting for the rest of that story!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (resignedly) Okay, Walter. (sits down at her  typewriter again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hildy begins typing again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I waited and waited and then I had  an idea and wired Albany to send me  a hundred dollars so I could get out  on bail... (desperately) I don't know what they'll think --  they sent it to the police station!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she barely stops  typing) We'll explain the whole thing to  them. (resumes typing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I got you into this, Hildy,  but it does seem to me that you can't  care much for me if you're willing  to let me stay locked up for two  hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce, you know I'm mad about you  and stop talking like that. (calling o.s. to Walter) Walter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Take the President's speech and run  it on the funny page... (turns to Hildy, o.s.) What is it, Hildy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was the name of the Mayor's  first wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean the one who drank so much?  Tillie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. (she types furiously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its top opens slowly and Williams' head sticks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Get back in there, you mock turtle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The desk-top falls, the fugitive disappearing within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: turning around toward Burns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you say anything, Mister Burns?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: covering up, fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- I was just talking to one of  the guys at the office. (indicating phone in  his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Burns) Oh. (turns to Hildy) I wonder what's keeping mother? She  was supposed to come down and get  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, she was here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd she go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out some place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She types away. Bruce grabs her and stops her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hildy! Where's mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh -- mother -- she -- I don't know  where she went.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you give her the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I was going to give it to her --  but she left hurriedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then suppose you give me the money.  Four hundred and fifty dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes. Here it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets the wallet. Burns comes into the scene and pulls another page out of her machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here it is, Bruce. One -- two --  three -- four hundred -- and fifty  dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drily) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: watching this with a grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Featuring the threesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hildy) And I'll take that certified check,  too. I've decided I can handle things  around here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Hildy, we've got to keep  going! Sorry, Bruce, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a second, Walter. Here, Bruce,  here's the check... And, oh, Bruce,  here's your wallet. I got it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking it and  surveying it coldly) You got it back, eh? There's something  funny going on around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hildy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits down and begins to type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm taking the nine o'clock train,  Hildy. And you can meet us at the  station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She types away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coming over to Bruce) I'll see she's there, Bruce, I promise  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dramatically) If she's not there, mother and I are  leaving anyhow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Hildy continues typing and doesn't even get it.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA TRUCKS WITH BURNS
dialogues.text: as he leads Bruce away toward door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know how you feel, Bruce, but you've  got to forgive her. She's only a  woman, after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suppose she is -- I have feelings,  too! Do you know where I've been for  the last couple of hours? Locked up  in a police station and she didn't  move to do anything about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ts! Ts! Ts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now I don't know where my mother  is. She may be lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll find her, Bruce, if I have to  put every detective in the city on  the job. Tell you what -- go over to  the Missing Persons Bureau and  describe your mother. What does she  look like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's -- well, she's very motherly.  That's about the best description I  know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) That's the kind of stuff they want!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as they come out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Bruce, let me see that money  Hildy gave you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The money? Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a lot of counterfeit big  bills going around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried) Gee! Take a look, will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands the money to Burns. Burns looks at it carefully hands it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this is all right, Bruce. I just  wanted to be sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, I want to be sure, too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hildy is typing furiously. Burns enters, grinning, locks door behind him and goes to phone and picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Duffy. Good. Stick close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and crosses quickly to look out the window.

dialogues.speaker: AT WINDOW
dialogues.text: Burns coming in to window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (despairingly) Now the moon's out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns away, crossing to the desk, the CAMERA TRUCKING  with him. At the desk he taps three times, being answered three taps from within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Three taps is me. Don't forget!  You're sitting pretty, now. Got enough  air?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises top an inch or two and fans air in to Williams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that better? Now breathe deep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear an intake of breath from inside the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attaboy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He closes the desk and turns back to the table. As he pas Hildy, who is still typing rapidly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking over her  shoulder) That's the stuff! Lam it into 'em,  Hildy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jerks the sheet from Hildy's machine, crosses to his d and picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello! Duffy, ready? Here we go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: reading from the page he has taken from Hildy's typewrite

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) "In the darkest hour of the city's  history --"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the end of the hall are glass doors through which can seen a turmoil of activity in the street outside -- newsb a crowd, and a mounted policeman or two. Bruce comes down the hall, his face set and angry. As he goes, he sees a s set over a doorway in the hall. It reads: MISSING PERSONS BUREAU. He stops and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Listen, did you impress it on Butch  that I want him and his gang here  right away? You did? Every minute  counts. All right. (puts receiver down  on table) Duffy's getting old!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Butch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over her typing) He'd better hurry. The boys'll be  coming back to phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coming into shot to  peer over her shoulder) Well, keep going! We want an extra  out on the streets before it's too  late!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up suddenly) Where's Bruce?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce? Oh -- er -- he went out to  get the tickets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What tickets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Railroad tickets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he coming back here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you hear him? Of course he's  coming back here. Keep going, will  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Burns leaves Hildy and goes over to desk and picks up phone again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Duffy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finding the door locked, he knocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as another knock comes, they take it big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling) Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the idea of locking this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Bensinger. That's his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) What's his name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door knob is rattled violently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bensinger -- of the Tribune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open this door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll handle him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA TRUCKS WITH HIM to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tribune, eh? Watch me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he comes in) Ain't you got any more sense than to -- ? (sees Burns and is  overcome) Oh, h-hello, Mr. Burns. Why, quite  an honor having you come over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (casually) Hello, Bensinger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, I just want to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts for the desk. Hildy's typing goes on, coming in over the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting for the  desk, suddenly  blocking his path) Quite a coincidence, my running into  you tonight. Isn't it, Hildy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was having a little chat about you  just this afternoon -- with our Mister  Duffy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (essaying a pleasantry) Nothing -- ah -- detrimental, I hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should say not! That was one swell  story you had in the paper this  morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deeply moved) Oh, did you -- care for the poem,  Mr. Burns?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled) The poem?... The poem was great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blinking at these  words) Remember the ending? (and he recites) " -- and all is well, outside his  cell, But in his heart he hears the  hangman Calling and the gallows  falling And his white-haired mother's  tears..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overcome) Heartbreaking! How would you like to  work for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: taking in table, Hildy typing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bensinger) We need somebody like you. All we've  got now are a lot of low-brows. Like  Johnson here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts shoving Bensinger away from the desk, toward th table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously, Mr. Burns?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clinging to him, Burns takes him to the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Duffy! I'm sending Bensinger over to  see you. (looking up at  Bensinger) Mervyn, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Roy. Roy V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a little laugh  at his own  forgetfulness) Of course! (into phone) Roy Bensinger, the poet. Of course  you wouldn't know! You probably never  heard of Shakespeare, either! Put  Mr. Bensinger right on the staff. (to Bensinger) How much are you getting on the  Tribune, Roy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventy-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you a hundred and a by- line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Burns continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Let him have everything he wants. (puts down the  receiver; turns to  Bensinger) Now hustle and write me a story from  the point of view of the escaped  man. (acting it out) He hides, cowering... Afraid of every  light, of every sound... hears  footsteps... his heart going like  that... And all the time they're  closing in... Get the sense of an  animal at bay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sort of a Jack London style?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leads him hurriedly to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got my rhyming dictionary in -- (indicating desk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting him to door) It doesn't have to rhyme!

dialogues.speaker: AT DOOR
dialogues.text: as Bensinger turns there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, I'm terribly grateful, Mister  Burns. Do you suppose there might be  an opening some time as foreign  correspondent? I parley a little  French, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burns shakes hands with him and opens the door with the o hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll keep you in mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (going) Au revoir, mon capitaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (never at a loss in  any language) Bon jour!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Continuing his French, he gets the door closed and relock and turns for the table, singing as he does so:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mademoiselle from Armontieres, parlay --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burns returns alertly to table, not noticing that Hildy h stopped typing, and sits staring moodily before her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phono) Duffy! Got this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rat from the Tribune is coming  over to get a job -- Bensinger, the  guy I told you about. Handle him  with kid gloves. Tell him to get  busy writing poetry... No, we don't  want him. Stall him along until the  extra comes out. Then tell him his  poetry stinks and kick him downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lays down receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: taking in Hildy. She looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Burns) Double-crossing swine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said it! But this'll teach him a  lesson. He won't quit his paper  without giving notice after this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hildy doesn't bother to reply. She rests her chin on her  hands and stares moodily ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tear into it, will you? Don't sit  there like a frozen robin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finished!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs the last sheet of paper out of her typewriter, k her and rushes over to the telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Duffy! All right -- here we go! And  got it out as soon as you can. I  want this paper out on the streets  in half an hour! (reading Hildy's copy) "So once more the Morning Post --"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diamond Louie, bearing evidence of a mishap, his hat crus his face bruised and his clothes torn, comes running down the sidewalk and up the steps into the buildings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hildy is up now, pacing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce ought to be back by now. Walter,  you're not trying anything again,  are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coming over to her) Hildy, you think I could? After this  story? (taking a flask from  his pocket) Here! You're just nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hildy takes the flask and takes a drink. There is a knock the door. Burns takes the flask from her, restores it to pocket and goes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me, Boss -- Louie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (opening the door) It's Louie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louie slips in and Burns relocks the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seeing Louie's  disarray) What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hildy crosses to Louie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frantically) Where's Mrs. Baldwin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do with her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost afraid to  speak) What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been in a fight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still out of breath) Down Western Avenue. We were going  sixty-five miles an hour. You know  what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take that mush out of your mouth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the old lady?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you!

dialogues.speaker: LOUIE
dialogues.text: as he gets breath and blurts:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We run smack into a police patrol.  You know what I mean? We broke it in  half!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moaning) Oh-h-h... was she hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she? Tell me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you. Can you imagine  bumping into a load of cops?! They  come rollin' out like oranges!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seizing him) What did you do with her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Search me! When I come to I was  running down Thirty-fifth Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You were with her. You were in  the cab, weren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exposing his bruised  scalp) Was I? The driver got knocked cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butter-fingers! I give you an old  lady to take somewhere, and you hand  her over to the cops!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, I handed her? The  patrol wagon was on the wrong side  of the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now everything's fine. She's probably  squawking her head off in some police  station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think she's talking much...  You know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He winks reassuringly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (paralyzed) Don't tell me -- was she killed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hopefully) Was she? Did you notice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, me with a gun on my hip and a  kidnapped old lady on my hands, I  should stick around asking questions  from a lot of cops! You know what I  mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hildy sinks into a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead... dead! That's the end!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burns comes into scene to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Fate, Hildy. What will be, will  be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wildly) What am I going to say to Bruce?  What'll I tell him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he really loves you, you won't  have to tell him anything. (whacking her on the  shoulder) Snap out of it! Would you rather  have had the old dame dragging the  whole police force in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I killed her. I'm responsible. Oh- h... what can I do now? How can I  ever face him? Oh, I hope he never  comes back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She buries her face in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me, Hildy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (springing up) I'm looking at you -- you murderer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it was my own mother, I'd carry  on! You know I would. For the paper!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling off to Louie) Louie, where'd it happen? I'm going  out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Post phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing Hildy) You stay here. I'll find out  everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hildy) Western an' Thirty-fourth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hildy jumps for the outside phone on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello -- hello...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Gimme Western four-five-five-seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (guarded) Who? (wildly) Hello, Butch! Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Mission Hospital? Gimme the Receiving  Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) What are you doing there? Haven't  you even started?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello -- Eddie? Hildy Johnson. Was  there an old lady brought in from an  auto smashup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Oh, for -- (yelling) H. Sebastian -- Butch! Listen, it's  a matter of life and death! Listen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Nobody? (jiggles hook) Morningside three-one-two-four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) I can't hear... You got who? Speak  up! A what?... You can't stop for a  dame now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Is this the Community Hospital?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (howling into phone) I don't care if you've been after  her for six years! Butch, our whole  lives are at stake! Are you going to  let a woman come between us after  all we've been through?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello, Max, Hildy Johnson. Was there  an old lady --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone, drowning  out Hildy) Butch! I'd put my arm in fire for  you -- up to here! (indicates up to where) Now, you can't double-cross me!...  She does? All right -- put her on.  I'll talk to her... Hello! Oh, hello,  Madam... Now listen, you ten-cent  glamour girl, you can't keep Butch  away from his duty... What's that?  You say that again and I'll come  over there and knock your eye out!  Hello? (turning, as he hangs  up) I'll kill 'em! I'll kill both of  'em! (into Post phone) Duffy! (to the universe) Mousing around with some big blonde  Annie on my time! That's co-operation! (screaming into phone) Duffy!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, will you? (into phone) You sure? Nobody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Duffy!!!! (listening) (into phone) Duffy!!!! (listening) Well, where is Duffy? (throwing receiver to  desk) Diabetes! I ought to know better  than to hire anybody with a disease. (turning) Louie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Louie) It's up to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loyally) Anything you want, Boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat it out and get hold of some  guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting for the  door, followed by  Louie) Anybody with hair on his chest. Get  'em off the street -- anywhere. Offer  them anything -- only get them. (confidentially) We've got to get this desk out of  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He unlocks the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know me. The shirt off my back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got plenty of money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean real money -- not counterfeit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always have both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling after him) And don't bump into anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He relocks the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lafayette two-one-hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning from door) That dumb immigrant'll flop on me. I  know it. (bitterly) Can you imagine Butch doing this to  me -- at a time like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burns steps into scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confidentially) If Louie doesn't come back in five  minutes we'll get it out alone.  There's millions of ways. We can  start a fire and get the firemen to  carry it out in the confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crosses to the desk and inspects it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Ring that number, will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hildy, oblivious  of her telephoning) Come here. See if we can move it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello -- hello! Is this the Lying --  In Hospital? Did you have an auto  accident in the last --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Will you come here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Oh, I see. I beg your pardon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I'm surrounded, with my back  against the wall, you're not going  to lay down on me, are you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She jiggles the phone hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (going to her) Hildy, you just can't leave me out  on a limb now. It -- it wouldn't be  cricket!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care what you say. I'm going  to find Bruce's mother. (she jiggles the hook  madly) Oh-h... (she hangs up) I'm going out and find her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grabbing her hat and purse, she starts for the door.

dialogues.speaker: HILDY, TAKING IN DOOR
dialogues.text: There is a loud knocking on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coming into scene  after Hildy) Don't open that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at the door) Who says so? I'm going to the morgue --  to look --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She unlocks the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Hildy flings the door open, only to find the Sheriff,  accompanied by two deputies -- Carl and Frank -- and  surrounded by McCue, Murphy, Schwartz, Wilson and Endicot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There she is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, Hildy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hildy makes a decision and tries to push through them, bu the Sheriff grabs her and pushes her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a minute, Johnson!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go o' me. What's the idea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your hurry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deputies seize her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your paws off me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold her, boys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burns comes into scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sheriff) Who do you think you are, breaking  in here like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't bluff me, Burns. I don't  care who you are or what paper you're  editor of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggling) Let me go! (hysterically) Fellows, something's happened to my  mother-in-law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang onto her! Keep her in here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Hildy breaks loose and retreats back into the room bef Hartman and the deputies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know what you're up to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably goin' out to get Williams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door was locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She and Mollie were talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know anything, I tell you.  There's been an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnson, there's something very  peculiar going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can send somebody with me if you  don't believe me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't born yesterday. Now the  boys tell me you and this Mollie  Malloy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's trying to put anything over  on you. I'm getting out of here and  you can't stop me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (comes into scene) You're not going anywhere. (to the Sheriff) She's got the story sewed up, Pete. (indicating Burns) That's why Burns is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on to you, Hildy. Let us in on  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (purring) If you've any accusations to make,  Hartman, make them in the proper  manner. Otherwise, I'll have to ask  you to get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pop-eyed; stammering) You'll ask me to what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to deputies, off) Close that door. Don't let anybody  in or out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Pinky! Give 'em a little  third degree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make them talk and you got Williams,  Pinky!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnson, I'm going to the bottom of  this. What do you know about Williams?  Are you going to talk or aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I know about Williams?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, boys. Take her along. I  got ways of making her talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deputies seize Hildy. She struggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out, you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously) What's the use of fighting, Hildy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hildy manages to get in a few resounding smacks on the  deputies' faces. The reporters swarm around the strugglin trio. There are shouts of: "I got her!" "No, you don't!"  "Aw, Hildy...", etc. In the struggle, Hildy suddenly drop her purse. It lands with a clank and comes open. A gun is revealed on the floor. Hildy picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, she's got a gun! Look out, she's  got a gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deputies and reporters start to close in on her  cautiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to face in  all directions) No, you don't! Walter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? Here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tosses the gun to Walter, but one of the deputies  intercepts the throw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the gun from the deputy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff stands frozen, staring at the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hildy) Where'd you get this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a right to carry a gun if I  want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not this gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burns comes into scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (easily) I can explain that, Hartman. When  Hildy told me she wanted to interview  Earl Williams I thought it might be  dangerous and I gave her a gun to  defend herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you did! Well, that's very, very  interesting. This happens to be the  gun that Earl Williams shot his way  out with!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What's that? Etc...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (advancing on Sheriff) Are you trying to make me out a liar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bitterly at Hildy) It's the last time I ever trust a  woman, Hildy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe Williams was gonna be her best  man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's pretty rotten, Hildy. Crossing  your own pals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shoving up to Hildy;  trembling) Where is Earl Williams? Where you  got him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sympathetically) You're barking up the wrong tree,  Hartman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you three minutes to tell  me where he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He went over to the hospital to call  on Professor Egelhoffer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (outraged) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a bag of marshmallows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff stands silent -- then hastily turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Hildy. Where is he?... This  is a sweet trick, Hildy... I thought  we were friends... Etc. (to Sheriff) Look here, Pete! What about Mister  Burns?... Ask the Master Mind! What's  he doing over here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing Burns' arm) Speak up! What do you know about  this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently but firmly  disengaging his hand) My dear Hartman!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves casually to a post before the desk and maintains it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can that! Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sheriff) The Morning Post is not obstructing  justice or hiding criminals. You  ought to know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? Well -- (turning to Hildy) Johnson, you're under arrest. (turning to Burns) You, too, Burns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly) Who's under arrest? You pimple-headed,  square-toed spy -- do you realize  what you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll show you what I'm doing. Burns,  you're guilty of obstructing justice  and so is the Morning Post. I'm going  to see that the Post is fined ten  thousand dollars for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll see nothing of the kind,  Sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll just start by impounding the  Post property. (pointing to  Bensinger's desk,  addressing Hildy) Is that your desk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumping) No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost simultaneously) Yes! What are you afraid of Hildy? I  dare him to move that desk out of  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you do, eh? (to deputies) All right, boys. Confiscate that  desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several of the deputies start toward the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to intercept  deputies) Hartman, if you take this desk out  of this building, I'll put you behind  bars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will, eh? Well, we'll see about  that. (to deputies) All right, boys. Take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm warning you -- it'll be a Federal  offense. (to deputy nearest  him) And you'll be an accessory!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll take a chance on that, Burns. (to deputies) Go ahead, boys. (the deputies continue  toward the desk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flanked by two policemen, Mrs. Baldwin, dishevelled, with her hat over one ear, is marching toward the Press Room,  bound for vengeance. Bruce, considerably upset, is with h As they reach the door to the Press Room, Mrs. Baldwin st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wait outside, Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, mother --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firmly) No! You'll weaken when you see that  little Jezebel! I'm going to tell  her what I think of her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She plumps her hat down more firmly on her head and march into the Press Room followed by the two policemen. Bruce  remains outside the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taking in door as it opens and Mrs. Baldwin, followed by policemen, comes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaping forward) Mother!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing out Burns  to the officers) That man there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hugging Mrs. Baldwin) Mother! Oh, I'm so glad to see you!  Are you all right? Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Baldwin indignantly shakes her off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the idea here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This lady claims she was kidnapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They dragged me all the way down the  stairs --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a minute. Did -- did -- (points to Burns) -- this man have anything to do with  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was the one in charge of  everything! He told them to kidnap  me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amazed) Are you referring to me, Madam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know you did!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about this, Burns? Kidnapping,  eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (round-eyed) Oh, trying to frame me, eh! I never  saw this woman before in my life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, what a thing to say! I was  standing right here - after the girl  jumped out of the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get the Mayor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's coming over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mrs. Baldwin) Now, Madam -- be honest. If you were  out joy-riding, drunk, and got into  some scrape, why don't you admit it,  instead of accusing innocent people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beginning to doubt  her senses) You ruffian! How dare you say a thing  like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Mother, he's just crazy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sheriff) I'll tell you something more. I'll  tell you why they did it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fidgeting) Come on, Sheriff. We've got to get  bail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing crescendo) I was in here -- and they had some  kind of murderer in with them. They  were hiding him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a bombshell. The room is electrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiding him? In here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy, followed by the reporters, comes into scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiding him where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where was he?... Where'd they have  him?... Etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with superb  indignation) Madam, you're a cockeyed liar! And  you know it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To emphasize his righteousness, he pounds on the desk thr times, forgetting that that is his signal to Williams. Th realizing what he has done, he gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burns advances from desk, the others retreating before hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anxiously) Come on, Sheriff, we've got to get  bail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three answering knocks come from the desk.

dialogues.speaker: DOORWAY IN B.G
dialogues.text: They jump around to face the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in the desk! -- For the love of --  He's in there! Etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aha! I thought so! Stand back,  everybody!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out, Sheriff. He may shoot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your guns out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The policemen and deputies get out their guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's harmless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't take any chances. Shoot through  the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't hurt anybody. You've got  his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panic-stricken) Oh, dear! Oh, dear!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You grey-haired old Judas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me out! Let me out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She streaks for the door, flings it open and goes. The  reporters tear out of scene to their telephones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to policeman) You stand there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: City Desk! Quick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme the Desk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to another policeman) You there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: City Desk! Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme Emil...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to a Deputy, pointing  with his gun toward  the window) You cover the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out where you're pointing that  gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff draws his men in around the desk, their guns  drawn on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme have the Desk! Quick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold the wire! I've got a flash for  you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hildy) Call Duffy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you don't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sheriff, furiously) Do you want to get us scooped?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emil? Hang on for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now then, everybody aim at the center.  And when I say three --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's murder!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (changing his mind) All right! Carl! Frank! One of you  get on each side of the desk. Take  hold of the cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now then! We got you covered,  Williams. Don't try to move. Now!  Everybody quiet and ready for an  emergency. I'm going to count three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it! Something coming up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold the phone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) I'll have it in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Right away now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning back to desk) Everybody ready? All right. Now then,  up with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two deputies raise the cover. Williams is revealed, cower in the desk, his hands over his face. The Sheriff rushes him, jabbing his gun into him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got you, Williams!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a wail) Go on -- shoot me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the police and deputies come in to assist the Sheriff. The reporters are telephoning in, the police shouting -- the voices mixing in, in incredible confusion, as the She rushes Williams to the door and takes him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl Williams was just captured in  the Press Room of the Criminal Courts  Building, hiding in a desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (all talking at once) Grab him! That's him! Don't let him  shoot! Stick 'em up! -- Etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) ...Williams in a rolltop --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) -- nabbed Williams hiding --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- found Williams' hiding place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He offered no resistance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Williams put up a desperate struggle  but the police overpowered --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) -- tried to shoot it out with the  cops but his gun wouldn't work, so --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- trying to break through the cordon  of police --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Williams was unconscious when they  opened the desk --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: grabbing the Post phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Duffy! The Morning Post just turned  Earl Williams over to the Sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: coming in the door with two policemen and leaping to get phone away from Burns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Duffy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff and police come into scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating Burns and  Hildy) Put the cuffs on those two!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police handcuff Hildy and Burns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An anonymous note received by the  Sheriff led to Williams' capture.  More later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) An old sweetheart of Williams'  doublecrossed him. Call you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's that old lady? Hey, Madam!  Where'd she go? Where's the old dame?  Etc., etc. They run out after Mrs.  Baldwin, the Mayor entering just  after they go. Burns and Hildy,  handcuffed together, stand near the  Sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello, girlie -- gimme Cooley. Quick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hartwell, you're going to wish you'd  never been born!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayor comes into scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine work, Pete! You certainly  delivered the goods. I'm proud of  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding the phone) Look kind o' natural, don't they,  Fred?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (happily) A sight for sore eyes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rolling in catnip) Aiding an escaped criminal! And a  little charge of kidnapping I'm  looking into. (into phone; suddenly) But that's the jail! There must be  somebody there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well! Looks like about ten years  apiece for you birds!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it? You forget the power that  always watches over the Morning Post.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your luck's not with you now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Cooley?... I caught Williams single- handed -- we're going to proceed  with the hanging per schedule!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wiggles the hook for another call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mayor) You're going to be in office for  exactly two days more and then we're  pulling your nose out of the feed  bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Give me the District Attorney's  office. (to Burns) I'll tell you what you'll be doing --  making brooms in the State  penitentiary. (into phone) Hello, D'Arrasty! This is Hartwell.  Come over to my office, will you?  I've just arrested a couple of  important birds and I want to take  their confessions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up. Burns makes a sudden lunge for the Morning P phone and cries into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Duffy! Get Liebowitz!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the lawyers in the world aren't  going to help you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the Morning Post you're  talking to!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enjoying himself) The power of the press, huh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs. Pinkus, the Governor's messenger, plentifully  stewed, reels in the door. He approaches the Mayor and Sh who have their backs to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at the Mayor) Bigger men than you have found out  what the power of the press is...  President!... Yes -- and Kings!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (woozy; handing Sheriff  the reprieve over  his shoulder) Here's your reprieve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayor and Sheriff spin around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a panic) Get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't bribe me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here, you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't. Here's your reprieve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to be City Sealer. I  don't like seals anyhow. They smell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to an officer) Throw him out, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seizing Pinkus with  her free hand) Who was bribing you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burns also seizes Pinkus who is being pulled out of shape

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wouldn't take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're insane!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (triumphant) What did I tell you? An unseen power! (to Pinkus) What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silas F. Pinkus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You drunken idiot! Arrest him! The  idea of coming here with a cock-and- bull story like that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a frame-up! Some imposter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute! (to the officers) Let go there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sheriff and Mayor) Murder, uh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanging an innocent man to win an  election!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a lie!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never saw him before!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Pinkus) When did you deliver this first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did you talk to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They started right in bribing me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's 'they'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating the Mayor  and Sheriff) Them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's absurd on the face of it, Mr.  Burns! He's talking like a child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the mouths of babes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's insane or drunk or something.  Why, if this unfortunate man,  Williams, has really been reprieved,  I personally am tickled to death.  Aren't you, Pete?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, you'd kill your mother to get  elected!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a horrible thing to say, Miss  Johnson, about anybody! (to Burns) Now, look here, Walter, you're an  intelligent man --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Just a minute. (to Pinkus) All right, Mr. Pinkus. Let's have  your story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I been married for ten years  and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Skip all that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loudly) Take those handcuffs off our friends,  Pete. That wasn't at all necessary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (springing to obey) I was just going to!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets the key from the officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter, I can't tell you how badly I  feel about this. There was no excuse  for Hartwell to fly off the handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unlocking the  handcuffs) I was only doing my duty. Nothing  personal in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are set free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys better quit politics and  take in washing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking over the  reprieve) Sheriff, this document is authentic!  Earl Williams has been reprieved,  this Commonwealth has been spared  the painful necessity of shedding  blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save that for the Tribune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Pinkus) What did you say your name was --  Pinkus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shows the Mayor a locket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the picture of my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very fine-looking women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mysteriously angered) She's good enough for me! And if I  was to go home and tell my wife --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand perfectly, Mr. Pinkus,  and as long as I am Mayor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which ought to be about three hours  more, I'd say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just until we can get out a special  edition asking for your impeachment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your arrest. You'll each get  about ten years, I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't make any hasty decisions, Mr.  Burns, you might run into a thumping  big libel suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to run into the Governor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to brush it  off) Now, my old friend the Governor and  I understand each other perfectly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eagerly) And so do I!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with superb contempt) So do you what, you hoodoo! (to Pinkus, suavely) And now, Mr. Pinkus, if you'll come  with us, we'll take you over to the  Warden's office and deliver this  reprieve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff, Pinkus and the Mayor go out of scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dreamily) Wait till those two future jailbirds  read the Morning Post tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter turns to Hildy and they suddenly smile at each oth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was that for a tight squeeze?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me you were worried!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
