dialogues.text: Worried! I was petrified. Weren't  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-uh. As long as we were in there  together pitching -- they couldn't  lick us. Well, it's been a lot of  fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) I mean -- working together. Just  like the old days. The things we've  been through, Hildy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've certainly been in some swell  jams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember the time we broke into the  D.A.'s office, and copied Fifi  Randell's diary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. What about the time we hid the  missing heiress in the sauerkraut  factory? Six scoop interviews!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah - but that time we stole Old  Lady Haggerty's stomach off the  Coroner's physician. We proved she  was poisoned though, didn't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) We sure did, but we had to go in  hiding for a week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the Shoreland Hotel. And our only  chaperon was the poor old lady's  stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't remind me. That's how we  happened to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She breaks off. There is a moment's pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Hildy. I didn't mean to be  making love to another man's fiancee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all right, Walter. It's as  much my fault as yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing at the clock) Bruce is making the nine o'clock  train. I told him you'd be on it --  unless you want to write this story  yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if it's my last story, I'd  like it to be a good one. But -- I  guess I can't, Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suit yourself, kid. This isn't for  me to decide. Of course, you could  make a later train and still be in  Albany tomorrow morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I suppose I could. But, Walter --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to have you the rest of  his life, Hildy. Can't you give me  another hour?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to do, Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip a coin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. (takes coin from her  bag) Heads I go -- tails I stay to write  the story. Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: gazing nervously at the hand holding the coin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She flips and catches the coin. She holds it tightly clas in her hand, afraid to look. They stare at each other a  second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously) Well -- what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost breaking) What's the difference? I'm going to  write that story -- and you know it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts the coin away without looking at it. Burns rushe to her, tries to take her in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hildy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furiously) Don't touch me! I'm not doing it for  you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Then why are you doing it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I'm a newspaper woman, Heaven  help me!

dialogues.speaker: SHOTS
dialogues.text: INT. CITY ROOM - Hildy typing away furiously. Copy Boy te sheets from her typewriter as she writes. Burns coming in and tearing sheets from typewriter. Linetype machines. Presses going. Headline: THE POST SAVES EARL WILLIAMS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Headline: POST SAVES EARL WILLIAMS! Over this sound of newsboys calling "Extra! Extra!" CAMERA DRAWS BACK to rest of story: "Impeachment Proceedings Launched Against Mayor For Attem to Conceal Governor's Reprieve!" CAMERA DRAWS BACK FURTHER to the by-line -- By Hildegarde Johnson. CAMERA DRAWS BACK STILL FURTHER to disclose Burns and Hil looking at paper on Burns' desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enthusiastically) The greatest yarn ever written by  anybody. My hat's off to you, Hildy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grimly) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what a way to quit. While you're  still champion! That's the way to  leave, Hildy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Only -- only I'm not leaving,  Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? Bruce'll be waiting  for you in Albany.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he won't. I wired him that I  wasn't coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you wire him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the nine o'clock train. That's  the one he took, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's awfully clear now. Bruce needs  a wife who can give him a home --  and affection -- and peace. I couldn't  do that for him, Walter. I'm what  you made me -- a cheap reporter who'd  give up her soul for a story!... Is  that job still open?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both jobs are open, Hildy. The paper --  and being Mrs. Walter Burns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Walter, but it's no good. We  tried it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, it was good -- it was wonderful!  Only you expected it to be like other  marriages. It can't be like other  marriages -- we're different! We're  a different world. Look at what we  went through today. I wouldn't trade  that for any honeymoon in the world.  I bet you wouldn't, either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fine honeymoon, with a murderer  right in the boudoir! And that other  honeymoon in a coal mine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what makes it romantic. Every  other married couple goes away on a  honeymoon and for two weeks the bride  knows just where the groom is, and  vice versa. But us -- you never know  where I am and I'm not sure where  you are. That's Romance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe I'd like to know just  once!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hildy, if that's what you want, all  right. We'll even go to -- how about  Niagara Falls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumping) Niagara Falls! Walter, you don't  mean that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure I do. And I'll tell you something  else -- I'd like a baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, I can't last forever. I want a  son I can train to take my place on  this paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you do if it was a  daughter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if she looked like you -- Say!  My brains and your looks -- that  mightn't be such a bad combination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter with my brains?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the good of arguing about  something that probably doesn't exist?  Look, Hildy, I'm proposing to you.  What do you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'd like to be lady-like and  think it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to rush you. Take a  couple of seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louie marches in with a judge, half-dressed. Louie has th judge in a tight grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Judge!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is an outrage, Mr. Burns! Sending  a gunman to kidnap me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, wait a minute, Judge. This isn't  a kidnapping. You've got the legal  power to perform a marriage ceremony,  haven't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now don't argue, Hildy. (to Judge) How about it, Judge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then go ahead. Come on, Hildy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's going to rush me into  anything! (as Louie sticks a  gun in her ribs) You keep away from me! (but she's scared)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Judge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reporters are standing on desks to watch through the glas partition of Burns' office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be doggoned! A shotgun marriage!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't they usually keep the gun on  the man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: reading the marriage ceremony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) " -- so long as you both do live?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what he said the last time.  Don't believe him, Judge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hildy, from this time on no tricks,  no double-crossing -- everything on  the level!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not fooling anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) "Hildegarde Johnson, will you have  this man as your wedded husband, to  live together in the ordinances and  estate of Matrimony?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you do with a gun in your  back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (poking her) Quiet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Will you love him, comfort him,  honor and keep him in sickness or in  health; --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I know where he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: " -- and, forsaking all others, keep  thee only unto him, so long as you  both do live?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will -- if he will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Burns) Have you got a ring?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burns starts searching his pockets, then, to Hildy:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he takes ring off) How about Bruce's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter, you can't do that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, I can. Look at the policy I  gave him! (placing Bruce's ring  on Hildy's finger) "With this ring I thee wed and with  all my worldly goods I thee endow:  And thereto I plight thee my troth."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, I'm surprised she got the ring  back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: " -- pronounce you Man and Wife."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burns throws his arms around Hildy and kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hildy, darling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes -- 'Hildy, darling'. I'm just a  fool. That's what I am. I know what  it's going to be like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be Heaven!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Heaven! You've probably thought  up another coal mine to send me down  in -- to get a new story for your  paper!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hildy turns over copy of the extra lying on Burns' desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "COUNTERFEIT PASSER CAUGHT!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Attempting to pass five hundred dollars worth of counter money at the Union station, a man giving his name as Bruc Baldwin of Albany, New York, was arrested last night -- "

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Counterfeit money! That's the money  you sent me, Walter! You -- you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting to run) But, Hildy, listen --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burns retreats from Hildy, she runs after him. He dashes  through glass-paned door into adjoining office. Hildy thr her bag at him and it smashes the glass pane in the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is pursuing him around table similar to one in Burns' office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Hildy -- I can explain --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You -- you!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's going to work out all  right this time.
